solution_line_template: On Monday there are {monday_less_percentage} * {tuesday_cars} = <<{monday_less_percentage}*{tuesday_cars}={cars_less_on_monday}>>{cars_less_on_monday} cars passing the street less than on Tuesday.
So on Monday, there are {tuesday_cars} - {cars_less_on_monday} = <<{tuesday_cars}-{cars_less_on_monday}={monday_cars}>>{monday_cars} cars on Happy Street.
On Wednesday, there are {monday_cars} + {wednesday_additional_cars} = <<{monday_cars}+{wednesday_additional_cars}={wednesday_cars}>>{wednesday_cars} cars on this street.

On Thursday and Friday, there is a total of {cars_per_weekday_end} * {num_days_thursday_friday} = <<{cars_per_weekday_end}*{num_days_thursday_friday}={thursday_friday_cars}>>{thursday_friday_cars} cars passing.
On the weekend {cars_per_weekend_day} * {num_weekend_days} = <<{cars_per_weekend_day}*{num_weekend_days}={weekend_cars}>>{weekend_cars} cars are passing.

So from Monday through Sunday, there are {monday_cars} + {tuesday_cars} + {wednesday_cars} + {thursday_friday_cars} + {weekend_cars} = <<{monday_cars}+{tuesday_cars}+{wednesday_cars}+{thursday_friday_cars}+{weekend_cars}={total_cars_week}>>{total_cars_week} cars traveling down the street.
